results.title: Eye of the tiger [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, ScreenWest, Artemis International, Brian Beaton, Celia Tait and Tosca Looby
results.brief_description: In the Khao Yai National Park, Thailand, a concerted effort is underway by the Wildlife Conservation Society to save the dwindling population of tigers. 95% of the tiger population has disappeared in the past 100 years, and in the last three years, only two Indo-Chinese tigers have been sighted in Khao Yai with humans outnumbering the creatures by ten to one in a market in which trading in tiger products is as lucrative as trading in cocaine. Poachers present the biggest threat to tigers; the animals they kill are the tiger’s potential food source, the trees that are chipped part of their habitat. Years ago people inhabited the National Park, now they have been forced to move to the outer perimeters of the park and rely on illegal hunting in the forest for survival. The program also follows the undercover activities of a group of conservationists and law enforcement agents to curtail the illegal trade in tiger products, particularly in Chinatown, Bangkok.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Finance Corporation Australia, ScreenWest, Artemis International, Brian Beaton, Celia Tait and Tosca Looby

results.title: Eye of the octopus
results.creator_credit: Sierpinski Films, Judy Siers and James Siers
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of a 13 year old New Zealand boy who lives for a summer with the people of Kiribati, a remote Pacific island and learns their customs. He learns fishing, snorkelling, sailing, and survival techniques. Finally he must capture and kill an octopus in the customary manner.

results.title: Eye of an artist
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Harry Webb
results.brief_description: An artist explains how he sees the framework of a painting, how he develops the angles and how he envisages the end result. Shows examples of his work.

results.title: Eye = L'oeil
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Pierre Moretti and Viviane Elnecave
results.brief_description: Inwardly, eyes may be the windows of the soul, but when the gaze is directed outward, they become much more than organs for perceiving the world around - they become also an instrument of involvement in all of life’s drama. In this highly imaginative animation film, one disembodied eye (one is all that it takes) embarks on life’s adventures, entering into and disengaging from all the many passions, vicissitudes and conflicts that beset one’s course. Music by Maurice Blackburn and sound by Michel Descombes.

results.title: Extremities
results.creator_credit: Atlantic Entertainment, Thomas Coleman, George W. Perkins, Michael Rosenblatt, Scott Rosenfelt, Burt Sugarman and Robert Young
results.brief_description: Attacked but unharmed by a masked assailant, Marjorie (Farrah Fawcett) lives in mortal fear that the unidentified man will strike again - especially since he knows where she lives. Her attacker (James Russo) breaks into her home again and subjects her to a night of terror and sexual humiliation, however Marjorie manages to turn the tables on him, knocking him unconscious and rendering him helpless. She is then faced with a major moral dilemma, should she turn him in to the police or should she mete out her own punishment, and if so, what would be a fitting form? This is a film about random violence and the focus of the movie is on the moral dilemma Marjorie faces, the depiction of graphic violence in the film is shocking at times, but a standout, harrowing performance by Farrah Fawcett makes it compulsive viewing.

results.title: Extreme prejudice
results.creator_credit: Carolco Pictures, Tri-Star Pictures, Buzz Feitshans and Walter Hill
results.brief_description: Director Walter Hill helms this macho neo-Western with aplomb, providing a plethora of violence and mayhem, in the style of Sam Peckinpah (Hill worked as a screenwriter on several Peckinpah films). Nick Nolte plays Jack Benteen, a Texas Ranger with an incendiary attitude (that apes Dirty Harry), driven by the lawlessness and brutality that has invaded his hometown since the drug trade has escalated there. Heading a key operation is former friend, Cash Bailey; Cash and Benteen are in love with the same sexy Mexican woman, currently Benteen’s girlfriend, which incenses their conflict. Benteen’s success in disarming his former friend is limited and he is countered by a crack team of mercenaries, all ex-army and officially dead or missing, who have been engaged to eliminate Cash and his merciless crew. The bloodshed in this film is quite relentless, lots of bullet-riddled bodies and big guns, interspersed with numerous high tech crimes. Hill tries to keep the central conflict interesting but the variety of sub-plots and the many scenes of testosterone fuelled vicious encounters, muddies the narrative focus.

results.title: Extreme art 2
results.brief_description: Further explorations in experimental music video from Western Europe. As in the first collection of “Extreme Art”, these industrial-electronic musicians use sound and images heavily influenced by European surrealism. In this volume many of the contributions show the influence of the acid- house music scene, with a greater use of sampling in the music and a greater reliance on computer animation in the video imagery. The collection spans across punk, industrial music, heavy metal and house to deliver music at the edge of chaos.

results.title: Extreme art
results.brief_description: This is a collection of Western European experimental music videos. Featuring collaborations between electronic composers and avant-garde image-makers, the artists in “Extreme Art” all share a commitment to an artistic expression the roots of which are to be found in surrealism and dada. The visual work combines computer animation, video collage, and super-8 film to present a menacing vision of technological society at the point of implosion. The music in this video ranges from minimalist electronic experimentation to bizarre combinations of indigenous ethnic music with computer simulated noise; to brooding, menacing industrial soundscapes. Though the artists represented in this music video sampler are all unique from one another, they are all uncompromising in their desire to produce work which unsettles and disturbs. NOTE: SOME OF THE VIDEO IMAGERY MIGHT BE DISTURBING. DO NOT ADJUST YOUR SET - SOME VIDEO SEGMENTS ARE DELIBERATELY UNSTABLE.

results.title: Extrasensory Perception
results.creator_credit: St Mary's Anglican Girls' College and Tallulah Chong
results.brief_description: Winner in the Senior Live Action category. Extrasensory Perception is a film which takes audiences on an emotional journey of confusion, suspense and realization. It is a complex narrative featuring an engaging crime and characters bearing supernatural powers…
